cui_name: Adult-onset chronic progressive external ophthalmoplegia with mitochondrial myopathy
reasoning: Adult-onset chronic progressive external ophthalmoplegia (CPEO) with mitochondrial myopathy is a rare mitochondrial disorder. CPEO generally has estimated prevalence of ~1-5 per 100,000 population. Adult-onset form with specific mitochondrial myopathy phenotype is rarer than general CPEO, estimated incidence ~0.5 per 100k based on mitochondrial disorder population epidemiology. Documented in Orphanet with limited case series data.
source: Orphanet: Adult-onset chronic progressive external ophthalmoplegia with mitochondrial myopathy (ORPHA:329336)
